data.prayer: Father, put the people who are lonely into families in the state of Gangwon-do.
data.verse: God sets the lonely in families. He brings out the prisoners with singing, but the rebellious dwell in a sun-scorched land.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Gangwon-do, South Korea

data.prayer: Jesus, you said you were the giver of evangelists to the church. Please, send more evangelists to the state of Gangwon-do, South Korea.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 6 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Jesus, please help the 252,291 believers in the state of Gangwon-do to be filled with joyful obedience at all times, as you modeled for us all.
Spirit, teach those feeling unsafe in Gangwon-do, South Korea that they can hide under your wings
data.verse: He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you will find refuge; his faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.

data.prayer: Lord, bring the blind by a way that they don’t know. Lead the Burmese people in paths that they don’t know. Make darkness light before them and crooked places straight. Do not forsake the Burmese people.
Lord, please provide elders whose hearts are completely yours in every town in the state of Gangwon-do.
data.verse: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.

data.prayer: Father, help 308 new simple churches start among the 1,542,100 people in the state of Gangwon-do, South Korea. One within reach of everyone living here.
data.verse: For the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the Lord as the waters cover the sea.

data.prayer: Spirit, how will they hear without a preacher? How will they preach unless they have a Bible? Please give the people in the state of Gangwon-do access to a Bible in their own language.
data.verse: How, then, can they call on the one they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them? And how can anyone preach unless they are sent? As it is written: “How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news!”

location.name: Gangwon-do
location.people_groups_list: Khmer, Vietnamese, Deaf, Thai, South Asian, general
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Khmer (46,000), Vietnamese (151,000), Deaf (103,000), Thai (102,000), South Asian, general (101,000)
